questions.q: What does this service help with?
questions.a: With one phone call, we handle or organize hospital, administrative, health, and daily life issues for you.

questions.q: Do I need to install an app?
questions.a: No. You only need a phone to use the service.

questions.q: Who is this service for?
questions.a: This is a phone-based life support service for middle-aged and senior individuals living alone.

questions.q: Do I need complicated operations?
questions.a: No. You just need to speak.

questions.q: Am I speaking with a human agent?
questions.a: Instead of a person, AI helps you over the phone.

questions.q: Can I speak slowly?
questions.a: Yes. You can speak slowly and comfortably.

questions.q: Does it remember previous conversations?
questions.a: Yes. It references previous conversations to help you better.

questions.q: Can you make hospital appointments for me?
questions.a: Yes. We call the hospital directly to handle appointments and inquiries.

questions.q: Can you handle district offices or community centers?
questions.a: Yes. We check procedures, documents, and relevant departments for you.

questions.q: Can you wait on hold for me?
questions.a: Yes. We handle waiting and IVR systems - you just get the results.

questions.q: How are results delivered?
questions.a: We call you back to explain or summarize the results.

questions.q: Can I request multiple revisions?
questions.a: Yes. If you need to reconfirm, we'll call again.

questions.q: What types of calls can you make for me?
questions.a: Hospitals, public institutions, and daily service inquiries.

questions.q: What if the call doesn't go through?
questions.a: We'll try again or provide alternative solutions.

questions.q: Can I describe my symptoms?
questions.a: Yes. We'll organize the information for you.

questions.q: Will you tell me if I should go to the hospital?
questions.a: It's not a diagnosis, but we can advise whether a visit is recommended.

questions.q: Do you replace doctor consultations?
questions.a: No. We do not perform medical acts.

questions.q: Can you help prepare questions before my hospital visit?
questions.a: Yes. We'll organize necessary questions for you.

questions.q: Can I get help when I'm anxious?
questions.a: Yes. We'll organize the situation and provide guidance.

questions.q: Are health records kept?
questions.a: Only to the extent necessary.

questions.q: Will my status be shared with family?
questions.a: Only briefly and only when necessary.

questions.q: Is my family always notified?
questions.a: No. Only in unusual situations.

questions.q: Will I feel surveilled?
questions.a: No. We prioritize your autonomy.

questions.q: What information is shared?
questions.a: Only minimal information such as condition summaries.

questions.q: Can I turn off sharing if I don't want it?
questions.a: Yes. You can adjust settings anytime.

questions.q: Can you block voice phishing?
questions.a: Yes. We detect suspicious calls in real-time.

questions.q: How are risks communicated?
questions.a: You'll receive an immediate voice alert during the call.

questions.q: Will you explain why it's risky?
questions.a: Yes. We provide clear and simple explanations.

questions.q: Do I have to hang up myself?
questions.a: Yes. The decision to hang up is yours.

questions.q: Will my family be notified?
questions.a: If necessary, we can notify your guardian.

questions.q: Can you provide weather or schedule information?
questions.a: Yes. We provide immediate guidance via phone.

questions.q: Can you remind me to take medication?
questions.a: Yes. We help with daily life reminders.

questions.q: What happens in urgent situations?
questions.a: We immediately connect you to help.

questions.q: How do I use the service again?
questions.a: Just call anytime.

questions.q: What's the biggest advantage of this service?
questions.a: You don't have to solve problems alone.

footer.tagline: Alone, but not lonely - with SOLOCALL
